description.narrative: Capacity at national and sub-national level developed for multi-dimensional education planning and budgeting and for tracking of and response to out-of-school children with a special focus on adolescent girls

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacity at national and sub-national level developed for multi-dimensional education planning and budgeting and for tracking of and response to out-of-school children with a special focus on adolescent girls

description.narrative: Achievements include the approved national gender strategy and associated implementation plans for Tete and Zambézia. Trainings occurred on preventing/reporting school-based sexual abuse, decentralized planning processes, and the integration of cross-cutting issues into the primary curriculum. UNICEF also supported a manual for school councils on school-based emergency preparedness and response. | Status:Met | As-of Date:20/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of education functionaries trained on planning and data collection and use in Tete and Zambzia

actual.value: 2016:115 POEMA (Planning, Budgeting, Execution, Monitoring and Evaluation): 61 Education Officers (28 in Tete and 33 in Zambézia) Evidence-based Planning: 54 Education Officers (36 in Tete and 18 in Zambézia)

title.narrative: Functional school management committees at primary and secondary level [score]

actual.value: 2017:In 2016, the Ministry of Education and Human Development completed roll-out of the national programme on building capacity of school councils.
2016:Yes. Prevention of and preparedness to natural disaster is part of the science subject
2016:Yes. School-based emergency preparedness and early response manual is finalized and will be rolled out after second round of piloting in Q2 2017.
